docs.lead_paragraph: The avarice of an adventurous Yankee who some year since imported into this country a huge weed from the land of spices, serpents, and poisons, where there is a good deal besides man that is vile, Bishop HERER to the contrary notwithstanding, has entailed upon this City a nuisance of the greatest magnitude.

headline.main: THE QUARANTINE QUESTION.; REFORMS PROPOSED. Meeting of the Board of Health. Report to the Chamber of Commerce on the Subject.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chamber of Commerce had a special meeting yesterday, ROYAL PHELPS, Esq., presiding, to hear and consider the report of its Committee, appointed some months since to consider the subject of Quarantime. MR. TILESTON (of the firm of STOFFORD TILESTON) read the report, which was as follows: REPORT.

docs.snippet: Further details of the important intelligence brought by the Arabia at Halifax reached us yesterday. All accounts indicate that another great battle would be fought in a very short time. The Allies passed the River Serio on the 13th towards the River...
docs.lead_paragraph: Further details of the important intelligence brought by the Arabia at Halifax reached us yesterday. All accounts indicate that another great battle would be fought in a very short time. The Allies passed the River Serio on the 13th towards the River Oglio, and at last advices their advanced guard was at Coccoaglio, and the headquarters of the King of Sardinia was at Palazzuolo,

docs.snippet: Captain AMOS PILSBURY, the newly elected General Superintendent of Police, yesterday entertained the Commissioners of Emigration and a party of invited guests at a farewell dinner given at his residence on Ward;s Island, upon the occasion of his...

headline.main: FAREWELL TO CAPTAIN PILSBURY; Dinner at Ward's Island--Speeches of the New General Superintendent of Police, and of the Commissioners of Emigration.

docs.lead_paragraph: Captain AMOS PILSBURY, the newly elected General Superintendent of Police, yesterday entertained the Commissioners of Emigration and a party of invited guests at a farewell dinner given at his residence on Ward;s Island, upon the occasion of his resigning his charge of the Institutions to assume the duties of the Police Department.

headline.main: Family Scandal--The Bennett Divorce Case in Philadelphia.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day or two since we published the statement of Mrs. RACHEL A. BENNETT, of Philadelphia, against whom her husband, JOSEPH M. BENNETT, has brought a suit for divorce. Mr. BENNETT has put in a rejoinder to his wife's statement, which develops some curious points. He declares that the common scandal about his wife's infidelity, which came to his ears, seriously affected his health; and then proceeds:

docs.snippet: While we have been wondering what they severally would do with it all, the Commissioners for Quarantine Removal have labored, day and night, until we are enabled to announce that the Quarantine Hospitals have been removed. Not the hospitals...

headline.main: QUARANTINE REMOVED.; INTERESTING CORRESPONDENCE. The Small-pox Patients Transferred to Black well's Island--The Rest Taken to Ward's Island. The Labors of the Re moral Commissioners almost Complete.

docs.lead_paragraph: While we have been wondering what they severally would do with it all, the Commissioners for Quarantine Removal have labored, day and night, until we are enabled to announce that the Quarantine Hospitals have been removed. Not the hospitals themselves, nor the physicians, nurses, orderlies, and doorkeepers that watch over them, but the patients are all gone,--with one solitary exception, and that one sim. ply an oversight.

docs.snippet: As visitors do not come to Saratoga for the sake of enjoying rain water, the weather of the past three weeks did not have the effect of filling all our hotels with guests. But such are the attractions of the place, that a very large number of...

headline.main: THE SEASON AT SARATOGA.; Visitors at the Springs-A new Spa-the Hotels; &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: As visitors do not come to Saratoga for the sake of enjoying rain water, the weather of the past three weeks did not have the effect of filling all our hotels with guests. But such are the attractions of the place, that a very large number of visitors have dropped in, notwithstanding the coolness and dampness of the reason.
